values:
Peter's phone had drifted in and out of service on the drive back to New York City. Once he'd gotten there he was so focused on getting to the hospital to try and save Hiro that he didn't check his voicemail until after he realized the man had disappeared. He called it, checked it and discovered that Nathan had left him a voice mail that sent him into a panic.

Sasha was in the hospital with contractions. It didn't take long to find her room and he made certain to calm himself down before he went into the room. He sort of forgot in his panic/calm down mindset that he was still wearing the black shirt with a hole in it. He walked into the room with a smile pasted on his face. He was trying not to be afraid, trying harder not to show it. He knew what the odds for Lexie were if she were born this early. 

"Bored staying at home?" he asked in what he hoped was a teasing tone of voice. He picked up Sasha's file on the way to the bed, glanced over it and then leaned over to kiss her lightly before going back to her file.

The day was perfect for the zoo, a little cool but warm enough that they could enjoy it. Fall in New York was nice and this was a perfect fall day. Peter had gotten the day off and he was making good use of it. He, Sasha and Henry were at the zoo. Peter had Henry on his shoulders as they walked around. His hands were around the little boy's calves in an attempt to keep him from kicking him repeatedly.

"Okay, where to next, Henry?" he asked, looking up at the little boy.

"Pee-ques," he answered. 

Peter laughed and looked over at Sasha. "Penguins. Do you feel like walking to see the penguins?"

You Are Carbs
You are a very energetic and seductive person. You tend to be driven by your impulses, and people often find you tempting.
Often your energy is brief and almost manic. You have a lot of ups and downs if you're not careful.

When you take care of yourself, you feel alert, balanced, and satisfied. You can live a very balanced life if you play your cards right.
When you don't take care of yourself, your life is a nightmare. You can be moody, cranky, and unpredictable.
Are You Protein, Carbs, or Fat?

Pick one of my characters and I'll tell you... - One thing that I enjoy about playing this character. - One of my favorite interactions this character has had with one of yours. - One of my favorite things about the relationship our characters have. - The last thing my character did "off screen". - One thing my character wants to say to your character. - One thing I'd like to see our characters do in the future. Bonus Round - I will tell you what character of yours I'd like to play mine against. - You may ask me a free question. Other Characters

Peter was jogging a little bit later than usual that morning. He'd woken up late, decided to stay and have breakfast and coffee before he'd taken off. He had his earbuds in, music blasting into his ears and he hadn't stopped to think when he'd seen the little boy in the street chasing a ball. He'd reacted, running into the road and shoving the little boy out of the way of the taxi on instinct. He'd realized even before he'd pushed the little boy that he wasn't going to be able to make it out of the way before the taxi hit him. The bumper caught his thigh because he was crouched a little from pushing the boy out of the way. He remembered flipping over the hood of the taxi and then being tossed up a bit to land on the roof before he slid to the asphalt. His last coherent thought had been that he should have grabbed Claire's power at some point.

He was unconscious when they brought the ambulance and stayed that way until long after they'd gotten him settled in a room. The doctor's weren't ready to label it a coma, he hadn't been out long enough but every hour he stayed unconscious made it look more likely.

I've given my characters a healthy dose of Veritaserum and now they have to tell the truth. What does this mean for you? Ask my characters questions about anything and everything and they will truthfully answer it. Specify game or PSL if you want to.

Your result for The Brutally Honest Personality Test...

Pollyanna- INFP

13% Extraversion, 67% Intuition, 27% Thinking, 13% Judging

So, you want to make the world a better place? Too bad it's never gonna happen.

Of all the types, you have to be one of the hardest to find fault in. You have a selfless and caring nature. You're a good listener and someone who wants to avoid conflict. You genuinely desire to do good.

Of course, these all add up to an incredibly overpowered conscience which makes you feel guilty and responsible when anything goes wrong. Of course, it MUST be your fault EVERYTIME.

Though you're constantly on a mission to find the truth, you have no use for hard facts and logic, which is a source of great confusion for those of us with brains. Despite this, in a losing argument, you're not above spouting off inaccurate fact after fact in an effort to protect your precious values.

You're most probably a perfectionist, which in this case, is a bad thing. Any group work is destined to fail because of your incredibly high standards.

Disregard what I said before. You're just easy to find fault in as everyone else!

Luckily, you're generally very hard on yourself, meaning I don't need to waste my precious time insulting you. Instead, just find all your own faults and insult yourself.

*****************

If you enjoyed that test, make sure you check out my latest venture: The Presidential Capacity Quiz - It's much shorter, just as fun and just as accurate. Find out how far you would get in the race for President. Are you fit to rule the free world?

*****************

When Sasha woke up this morning Peter had made blueberry pancakes (with Henry) and they were served to her in bed. On the bedtray there was this: The red bead is for putting up with Peter The silver dog bead is for Tex and Lola The baby bead is for Henry and the new baby. HAPPY MOTHER"S DAY

Peter had dinner with Sasha and Henry then took the subway down to the bar around the corner from his old apartment building. He sat down at the bar where he could see the door and ordered a beer. This would be the first time he'd seen Nathan 'out in the real world' and he was a little anxious over it. Of course that could be the news Peter had to tell him. He was excited and he was nervous and it was going to be nice to have his brother to talk to. If he could just have his brother back. Peter set his cellphone on the bar so that he wouldn't miss a call and took a sip of his beer. Nathan had said he might be a few minutes late. Either way, it wouldn't matter much. Peter could wait.

Peter was so excited to be home, he couldn't stand it. Sure he was exhausted but everyone was alive and he was getting to go home. For good. Or at least that was the idea. The doorman recognized him (surprise) and waves him on up. Peter rode the elevator, bouncing on the balls of his feet. The elevator couldn't go fast enough. It finally arrived at the right floor and he forced himself to calm down. He unlocked the door and opened it, strolling in casually like he'd been out for a gallon of milk. "Honey! I'm home!"

Peter had a knit cap with a bill on it pulled down low. He was wearing black and he landed in the middle of the desert a little way from the motel a few minutes before midnight. He got a room, registering under Steve McQueen. He'd told Sasha to look for Henry's favorite character, knowing she'd know it was Lightening McQueen. He'd gotten a knowing look from the guy at the front desk when he told him that a pretty brunette would be showing up in the next hour or so asking for him. Right now he was lying on his back on the bed, hands behind his head. His eyes were closed but he wasn't sleeping. He didn't have the TV on. He was thinking, about whatever he wanted to think without any concern that Parkman would be picking up bits and pieces of it.  There was a kind of freedom in it that he hadn't appreciated until Nathan had started pulling a Hitler, sending them all on the run.

Nathan and the government had already found him four times. He'd gotten away four times and he'd saved Matt from them once. He was pretty sure it couldn't get much worse and there was no way Nathan would kidnap Sasha and Henry. As the PR rep for Wayne Enterprises, Sasha was in the public eye far too much for that. It didn't worry him as much as it once had.

He touched down lightly in a tiny, tiny town with a pocket full of quarters and walked to a phone booth. It was dark and Peter was betting on Sasha having put Henry down for bed already. He took a deep breath, hesitantly reaching out to pick up the phone. He didn't want to argue with her but waiting any longer to contact her wasn't fair. He put a bunch of quarters into the phone and dialed her cell number then waited, hoping she'd pick up an unknown number.

Decisions I stand by:

Saving Claire
Saving Nathan
Marrying Sasha
Adopting Henry
Destroying the formula
Come look at Peter's new layout <lj user=mybrothershadow> Nope it doesn't make sense for him to have that header. Nope. I don't care. It cracks me up anyway. That picture just needed to be used.
Request any fic of mine and I will provide you with a commentary/annotations, like a DVD extra. Have at it. I'm kind of lackidaisal about my tags. I should give Peter's tags a refresher.

[Gifts I'm giving] For Nathan cufflinks I know you've got a bunch of them but I don't think you have these. Mom a Black Tiffany's Bag Claire According to Sasha and Heidi, every girl loves blue boxes. John Titanium Cufflinks Dude I have no idea if you have any use for them at all but I figure with the shelter you've gotta get out and do more promotion stuff and you could use a nice pair. Also they're titanium so the melting point is ridiculously high. If you don't like them, take them back to Tiffany's and talk to Melanie. She's my girl there. She'll find something you do like. Sasha I thought I might be going overboard but Melanie assures me I'm not: Charm Bracelet Naughty or Nice Charm Cashmere Wrap in Pink A bag in beige and Tiffany's Blue Pink Passport Holder Because we're travelling and you'll need it. Pink Paloma Picasso Tiffany's watch From Henry and yes he did pick it out. He rode on my shoulders around Tiffany's until he found something he thought 'Sashy' would like: Pink Sapphire and Diamond ring Because according to Henry 'Its PINK. Sashy likes PINK'

<lj-cut text="A ton of questions from Sasha">

1) are your parents married or divorced?
Married. Petrelli's don't get divorced. We just put the other one into a coma or have them killed.

2) vegetarian?
Nope.

3) heaven?
Yes

4) come close to dying?
Close to? Yeah.

5) what jewelry do you wear?
My wedding band. Sometimes a pendent or something

6) are you eating?
Yeah some cookies Mac made. I have to test them and make sure Henry will like them.

7) do you eat the stems of broccoli?
Yes.

8) makeup?
...nope not since high school.

9) virgin?
Not for a while.

10) would you ever have plastic surgery?
If I were horribly scarred or something, yeah.

11) what do you wear to bed?
Boxers or nothing, depending on whether Henry sleeps with us or not.

12) have you ever done anything illegal?
Yeah

13) can you roll your tongue?
Yes

14) pluck your eyebrows?
No

15) what kind of watch(es) do you wear?
I've got a Rolex. I don't usually wear it.

16) abortion?
That's not my decision to make. I mean in general. If it were Sasha, I'd discourage her from getting one but then I know she wouldn't anyway so it's sort of a moot question. Honestly, I don't believe in them but then I've never been in that position so I don't think I should weigh in on it.

17) Hair color?
Brown

18) future child's name?
Alexandria (No, really.)

19) do you snore?
I don't think so. Ask Sasha.

20) if you could go anywhere in the world on a vacation, where would you go?
I don't know. Italy with a stop over in Paris?

21) do you sleep with stuffed animals?
Nope

22) if you won the lottery, what would you do first?
Donate it.

23) gold or silver?
They make jewelry in gold and silver? Kidding. My sales lady at Tiffany's always says platinum and I think it's prettier.

24) hamburger or hot dog?
Hamburger

25) if you could only eat one food for the rest of your life, what would you choose?
Pizza.

26) beach, city, or country?
I don't know. I used to say city and I still love the city but I spent summer at the beach and I really loved it. I say both. We've got a penthouse in the city and a beach house in Malibu.

27) who was the last person you touched?
Tex count?

28) where do you eat?
Depends. Sometimes the table, sometimes the island, sometimes on the balcony or the in the living room.

29) when's the last time you cried?
Today.

30) have you loved somebody so much it makes you cry?
Yes.

31) would you ever go out dressed like the opposite sex?
No.

32) ever been involved with the police?
No. I mean I've been arrested and interrogated but I'm not sure that counts.

33) believe in Santa?
No, but Henry does.

34) do you talk in your sleep?
sometimes

35) beach or pool
Beach. You can't surf in a pool

36) can you cross your eyes?
Yeah. It makes Henry giggle.

37) what's your favorite song at the moment?
Gotta Be Somebody by Nickelback

38) window seat or aisle?
Window.

39) ever met any famous bands/singers/actors?
Yeah

40) do you feel that you've ever had a truly successful relationship?
I'm in one now.

41) do you twirl your spaghetti or cut it?
Twirl. You can't *cut* spaghetti

42) rickie lake or oprah winfrey?
Not really that into talk shows. If I am, I watch Maury or Jerry Springer. It helps me realize my family isn't the only insane one out there. I think we make the top of the list though

43) would you ever admit to having done plastic surgery of any kind if confronted?
Yes.

44) how long does your shower last?
Eh depends. Sometimes I want a really long one and sometimes I can't stand taking a hot shower.

45) do you drive stick?
Yeah. Layla is a stick shift.

46) cake or ice cream?
Usually cake but ice cream isn't too shabby.

47) where'd it go?
To hell

48) what time do you get up?
five-thirty. 

49) have you ever given money to a bum?
Yeah.

50) when was your first crush?
I don't know really. I can't remember.

51) where do you wish you were?
In bed with Sasha

52) have you ever broken someone's heart?
I don't think so but maybe.

53) ever been given a ring?
Yeah a wedding band

54) Longest relationship?
Two years.

55) last gift you received:
Henry

56) last sport you played?
Tickle wars with Henry

57) things you spend a lot of money on?
<s>Comic books? I don't know.</s> Henry and Sasha

58) where do you live?
New York City

59) high school you attend(ed):
A catholic private school

60) last wedding attended:
My own.

61) favorite fast food restaurant:
Burger King

62) where do you work:
Right now, no where. Even when I do work, I'm a private hospice nurse so it's not so much a where as a for who.

63) can you cook?
Blueberry pancakes, eggs, simple things.

64) most hated food:
Brussels sprouts

65) can you sing?
Nope

66) last concert attended:
I went to see a Jimmy Eat World several years ago.

67) favorite nonalcoholic drink:
milk

68) favorite alcoholic drink:
Beer

69) current crush?
Yup. On my wife.

</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="Spoilers for S3">

Okay so, Things in Peter's life are as they were shown in the mid season finale. As far as I can see/tell/am assuming. Peter has his original empathy power back. All the other powers are reset. Right now he has Nathan's flight and Flint's fire (which gave him the invulnerability to the flames he walked through to get to Nathan)

Currently he is estranged from Nathan but he knows nothing of Nathan's plan to have heroes hunted. In addition to what we saw on screen, most everyone knows by now Peter and Sasha 'eloped' and are married. I'm not sure where they'll be spending Christmas but we (Me and Sasha's mun) plan on trying to let Peter and Sasha have as good a Christmas Vacation as possible.

Thanks for hanging on with me and this wild ride Kring + Sasha mun + Me are taking you on!!

Merry Christmas!

</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text="Spoilers for Heroes mid season finale">

Peter flew home, landing on the rooftop of their apartment building. He used the roof access to get to the penthouse, shutting the door behind him. "Hey...I'm home," he said kind of quietly. He wasn't sure what to feel. He'd saved the world, he had his powers back and yet he'd lost his brother. Nathan had turned on him because he wouldn't join his crusade...because he opposed his crusade. Right now he just wanted to sit with Sasha and try and forget all about it.

</lj-cut>

Peter was nervous. He couldn't help it. The last time they'd tried this it had been a bit of a disaster. This time, however, there were no guests, no flowers, no music and no pressure. It was just him, Sasha, Henry and Tex. Plus the preacher. They both wanted to make sure it was legal. This wasn't what they'd planned. It wasn't what they'd imagined but the result was still something they wanted. 

Right now he was standing on top of the roof of their new apartment building with Sasha's hand in his. Henry was playing with Tex and they'd both been bribed with cookies to be good. Eloping didn't always mean going somewhere.

Really, almost anyone. I'm not a hero anymore but I'm still a nurse and I'm supposed to save lives and be there for people when I can't.
Post a CONFESSION Meme

25.4 - "Sit with a pretty girl for an hour and it feels like a minute. Put your hand on a hot stove for a minute and it feels like an hour. That's relativity" - Albert Einstein OOC: Co-written by and . is used with permission of her mun. Excerpts from story read are obviously from 'Green Eggs and Ham' By Dr. Seuss. He wasn't sure why Sasha had thought that either of them was willing to do manual labor right now. But the instant Nathan had seen Peter attempt to lift a box and set it back down with his face scrunched up in pain, he had picked up the phone to hire movers. A couple hundred more dollars had convinced the movers that this was an immediate emergency that needed attending to right now. Within the hour a team of half a dozen movers were there to unpack furniture and boxes into Peter and Sasha's new apartment for them. All Sasha had to do was direct and point them in the right direction, which box went to which room and likewise with furniture. It was that direction that left Nathan and Peter with the delegated responsibility of playing with Henry. At the moment, each of them were on the floor in a triangular circle between the three of them. They all held small Hot Rods cars and Henry was busy making 'broom-broom' car noises. Nathan slid his car to head-butt Peter's and smirked, a small grin teasing over his lips. "Oops." Peter smirked at Nathan and shook his head, bumping Nathan's car back. Nathan shrugged lightly, amusement coloring his features. "It slipped." Henry watched it for a moment and then decided he needed to give his input to the situation. "Pete, Nate, no do dat. You break, Sashy get upset an' Henry too." Peter had to choke back a laugh, nodding to give himself a moment to catch the laugh. "Right, sorry about that Henry. Nathan has no manners." He stuck his tongue out at Nathan when Henry wasn't looking. "Maybe we should line them up and race them. Push them across the floor and see whose gets there first?" "Kay," Henry said after a moment's thought. When he'd had his powers, Peter had always propelled Henry's car just a little bit further and faster using telekinesis. He couldn't do that now so he'd have to settle for pushing his car a little softer. They got the cars lined up across the wood floor. Nathan stuck his tongue out at Peter in retaliation. He knew this game too well. It was one he had played with Peter when he had been young and then Simon and Monty several times over. Through his experience he knew that Henry would have much more fun if he won and therefore planned to once again, as he had many times before in his lifetime, gently push his car to let Henry win and even Peter. His brother was injured after all and deserved the handicap. "Okay, Buddy, you count 'em down," Peter told Henry. "One," Henry said, glancing to Nathan and Peter to make sure their cars were toeing the line. "Two." The little red headed boy stuck the tip of his tongue between his teeth, gearing up to push his car off. "Twee!" Henry pushed his car as hard as he could, sending the matchbox car careening wildly across the floor. Barely giving the little car any motivation, Nathan made a show of pushing it across the floor. The little car that could have moved only a couple of feet before slowing to a stop. Peter's moved a little further than that and Henry's went soaring. Nathan snapped his fingers and clucked his tongue, feigning a disappointment in the stunted trek his car had made. But Henry leaped up to his feet, his hands above his head as he squealed with an all-encompassing delight. In response a rare, full smile broke out over Nathan's lips. "You won! I've always thought we needed a race car driver in the family." He joked. Peter sighed and shook his head, giving Henry dejected look, just barely keeping his grin in check. "You beat me. Again. Nathan's right, you're going to end up a famous race car driver." He knew Nathan had purposely let both of them beat him. "S'okay, Pete," Henry told him, patting Peter's shoulder. "You better than Nate." That made Peter bust out laughing, unable to hold back any longer. "Nate doesn't drive that much," he told Henry with a wink. "He's got a driver that does it for him." "So he can play while driver driving?" "Yup," Peter nodded. Henry looked over at Nathan, appraising him carefully. "S'mart. Sashy drives me too so's I can play." Another light smirk escaped Nathan and he lifted his shoulders in a small shrug. "What can I say? I like to play." In all reality, his play was work. While his driver was driving him from place to place, whether to and from his D.C. offices or his New York offices, he was on the phone, on his laptop, looking through paperwork, etc. But for his boys and Henry it was indeed better to refer to it as play. He liked hearing both Peter and Henry laugh. There was something comforting and homey about it that felt good to be a part of. Through the rest of the spacious apartment, the sounds of Sasha and the movers were muffled through the closed door of Henry's bedroom. He glanced at his wristwatch at the time. Sasha had said that nap time was at one o'clock and they were getting close to that hour. "I like to take naps too." "No bed," Henry declared firmly. "Aww come on, Henry. Naptime is good. Nathan and I will read you a story," Peter offered. Henry thought about that for a moment. He looked from Nathan to Peter to the bed and back again. "You bed too," he told Peter and Nathan. Peter glanced over at Nathan and shrugged. They could lay down with Henry for a few minutes, until he fell asleep and then go have a beer. "Okay, we'll take a nap too." He laid down on one side of the queen sized bed and patted the middle of it. "You can lay between us." He often weasled his way into sleeping between Sasha and Peter anyway. "Kay," Henry said, climbing up on the bed with minor effort. He laid down next to Peter, his head on the pillow and looked expectantly at Nathan. Reaching over to the bookshelf, Nathan grabbed a random book and then moved to the bed. He laid down on the opposite side of Henry with his back propped up against the headboard. Opening the book, he held it out from him a ways so that Henry could see the pictures as he began to read. "Sam I am. I am Sam. That Sam I am. That Sam I am. I do not like that Sam I am. Do you like green eggs and ham? I do not like them Sam I am. I do not like green eggs and ham..." He continued to read, drawing each word out and exaggerating the inflection of his tone as he always did when reading to children whether his or otherwise. Peter watched as Henry listened fairly attentively to Nathan's reading. He leaned over and whispered to him that Nathan used to read to him when he was a little boy. That earned Peter a smile. Slowly, steadily, Peter ended up drifting as much as Henry did, perhaps more. Occasionally he'd catch himself, glancing up when he'd catch himself falling asleep. Henry, however was wide awake but obeying the rules of nap time; still and quiet. "Would you eat them in a box? Would you eat them with a fox? Not in a box. Not with a fox. Not in a house. Not with a mouse. I would not eat them here or there. I would not eat them anywhere. I would not eat green eggs and ham. I do not like them, Sam I am." The story completed, Nathan quietly closed the book and set it on his chest, holding it there with one hand. He looked down to Henry to find him still awake. Placing one index finger at his lips he pointed to Peter, half asleep and then settled down into the pillow. Henry grinned as if he and Nathan were sharing some big secret since Peter was seemingly asleep and the little boy buried his head in Nathan's side. It was almost half an hour later when Henry looked as if he had fallen asleep. Nathan only noticed it as he slowly dosed off also. Henry watched as Nathan fell asleep; when he appeared to be completely out, Henry scrambled out of the bed, over Nathan and Peter, bare feet touching the floor lightly. He snuck out of the room and padded into the kitchen where Sasha was putting things up. "Pete an' Nate bed," he declared to Sasha. "What?" Sasha questioned, crouching down to look at Henry, who should have been down for a nap. "Pete and Nate tired. Go bed. Henry's bed." He was obviously very pleased that they had chosen to fall asleep in his bed. Sasha laughed and ruffled a hand through Henry's hair. "We have to teach you new words; Epic fail." "Pic fail," Henry repeated. Sasha grinned and nodded. "Yup. Peter and Nathan, epic fail."
Nathan and Peter Petrelli ~ Heroes ~ 1,525 Words
